law.text:
As used in KRS 45.351 to 45.359 unless the context otherwise requires:
"Block grant" means any federal block grant authorized by the federal Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (P.L. 97-35) and any subsequent amendments thereto and any federal block grant authorized by the United States Congress after July 1, 1983.
"Commission" means the Legislative Research Commission.
"Designated review body" means either:
Any interim joint committee, as designated by the Commission at any time when the General Assembly is not in session, whose subject jurisdiction relates to the block grant under review; or
Any interim joint committee, as designated by the Commission at any time when the General Assembly is not in session, whose subject jurisdiction relates to the block grant under review plus the Interim Joint Committee on Appropriations and Revenue; or
Any standing committee, as designated by the Committee on Committees during any legislative session, whose subject jurisdiction relates to the block grant under review; or
Any standing committee, as designated by the Committee on Committees during any legislative session, whose subject jurisdiction relates to the block grant under review plus the Senate and House standing committees on appropriations and revenue.
"Federal administering agency" means any agency of the United States government administering any block grant.
"State administering agency" means any agency of the Commonwealth submitting an application for block grant funding to the secretary or chief public official of the federal administering agency.
law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 308, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 455, sec. 1, effective July 1, 1982.
